definition: S.D. Poisson (1781-1840), French mathematician/also pr. [Po1 song1]

sentences.english: Demand follows a non-homogeneous Poisson process at each price level.
sentences.chinese: 在每個價格水平下，需求服從非齊次泊松分佈。

sentences.english: Another development in the history of probability theory is the French representative of the Poisson .
sentences.chinese: 另一在概率論發展史上的代表人物是法國的泊松。

sentences.english: And the fancy word for that is Poisson.
The linear triangular element method of the Poisson equation is considered in this paper.
sentences.chinese: 本文作者討論的是泊松方程的線性三角元法。

sentences.english: Methods to discretize the Poisson integral are investigated in this study.
sentences.chinese: 因而本文研究泊松積分的離散方法。

sentences.english: The double compound Poisson risk model under constant interest force is considered.
sentences.chinese: 考慮了常利力下雙複合泊松風險模型。

sentences.english: A numerical solution method named section-by-section method was introduced to solve the Poisson equation.
sentences.chinese: 提出了分段計算求解泊松方程的數值計算方法。

definition: Ludwig Boltzmann (1844-1906), Austrian physicist and philosopher
Bayes (name)/Thomas Bayes (1702-1761), English mathematician and theologian
Henri Poincaré (1854-1912), French mathematician, physician and philosopher
Lagrange (name)/Joseph-Louis Lagrange (1735-1813), French mathematician and physicist
Werner Heisenberg (1901-1976), German physicist/also written 海森伯

pinyin: zui4 da4 si4 ran2 gu1 ji4
